passages.text: Upgrade to Buy from Neutra on growth & margin turnaround driven by PCB and consumer electronics equipment
002008.SZ 12m Price Target: Rmb44.80 Price: Rmb36.37 Upside: 23.2%

We upgrade Han's Laser to Buy from Neutral with an updated 12m TP of Rmb44.8 implying c.20% upside. We expect to see earnings growth and margin turnaround in 2025, after 3 years of yoy EBIT decline in 2022- 2024, driven by increasing AI related demand in the PCB equipment business in 1H25 and new consumer electronics equipment opportunities driven by the upcoming form factor changes in the smartphone industry.

For the PCB equipment segment, we expect AI- related PCB capacity expansion demand to drive 30% segment sales CAGR in 2024- 2027E (vs. - 6% sales CAGR in 2021- 2024), leading to higher AI- driven sales mix of \(\sim 40\%\) by 2027E and \(\sim 50\%\) by 2030E (vs. \(\sim 20\%\) in 2025E) and hence higher GPM given higher technology requirement and customization vs. traditional PCB demand. In 1H25, PCB equipment sales grew by 52% yoy and contributed 31% of total sales, mainly resulting from the surging PCB mechanical drilling orders from Victory Giant (300476. SZ, Not Covered), which is a major PCB supplier to the US GPU supply chain.

For consumer electronics equipment, we expect form factor changes to drive 19% segment sales CAGR in 2024- 2027E (vs. - 10% sales CAGR in 2022- 2024, during which we believe the majority of segment sales were related to maintenance or upgrade projects rather than form- factor changes), such as the foldable iPhone18 noted by our US Hardware Tech analyst (see also: Apple F3Q25 preview: Expect strong revenue trends; beat on gross margins, forex) and our global Tech team estimates of 40% global foldable phongshipment CAGR in 2024- 2027E (see also: Global Tech: Smartphone TAM update: Foldable phones / Premium models better placed; overall market remains in modest growth).
Earnings, TP, and rating revisions: We revise up our 2025E- 30E

net income forecasts for Han's laser by \(30\%\) on average to reflect the strong 2Q25 results beat, solid PCB equipment outlook driven by AI applications, and the upcoming consumer electronics equipment growth inflection driven by form factor changes. Our 2025- 27E sales/net income forecasts are on average \(+7\% / + 16\%\) vs. Bloomberg Consensus, mainly because we are optimistic on the PCB/consumer electronics equipment outlook and the contribution to firmwide margin improvement. Our updated TP is Rmb44.8 vs. Rmb25.5 previously), based on 30x 2026E P/E (vs. using 20x 2026E P/E previously considering (1) the higher earnings growth forecasts (20% CAGR vs. previously \(14\%\) CAGR in 2026- 30E) and ROE forecasts (average \(11.8\%\) vs. previously \(8.9\%\) in 2027E- 30E); (2); and (3) A cross- check of the correlation between TP implied P/E vs. long- term earnings growth for our China Industrial Tech coverage. As such, we upgrade the stock to Buy from Neutral with \(c.20\%\) upside potentials (vs. average \(- 14\%\) downside for our China Industrial Tech coverage). Downside risks: (1) End- market capex growth slowdown; (2) Customer concentration risk; (3) Market competition.
Exhibit 1: We expect \(+17\%\) sales CAGR in 2024-27E (vs. \(-3\%\) CAGR in 2021-24)

End- market capex growth slowdown: We currently forecast solid PCB and consumer electronics equipment demand growth for the company. Looking ahead, if PCB equipment demand (especially those associated with AI hardware) grows slower than expected, or the form factor changes in the consumer electronics space
are delayed for any reason, our sales growth forecasts will be adversely affected.

- **Customer concentration risk:** Some of Han's Laser product segments have high concentration from a single customer or end-user, such as Apple in the consumer electronics segment, and Victory Giant in the PCB equipment business. If the business with these major customers is disrupted, possibly due to geopolitical uncertainties, wallet share losses, or technology changes, our sales and earnings forecasts will have downside risks.

- **Market competition:** Han's Laser engages in a variety of equipment types as well as end-markets, including PCB, consumer electronics, semiconductors, battery, general industrials etc. Going forward, if the competition in one or more end-markets is more intense than our expectation, our growth assumptions and sales forecasts will be negatively impacted.
Exhibit 9: Han's Laser financial summary
Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
The author would like to thank Zhou Li, Hao Chen, Zhihan Ye, and Junfang Zhang for
their contributions to this report.
Investments, valuation methodology and risks

Han's Laser is the largest laser equipment provider in China, with diverse end-market exposure, such as PCB, consumer electronics, lithium battery, FPD/semi, general industrials. We expect to see earnings growth and margins turnaround in 2025 after 3

years of EBIT yoy decline in 2022- 2024, driven by increasing Al- related demand in the PCB equipment business in 1H25 and new consumer electronics equipment opportunities due to the upcoming form factor changes in the smartphone industry. We believe the share price is attractive given the TP implied P/E vs. long- term earnings CAGR correlation among our China Industrial Tech coverage.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.
